meanings.definition: To choose or select in advance
meanings.sent1: The teacher will preelect the class monitor before the school year starts.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to preelect the president for the upcoming term.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if we could preelect our future selves for different roles.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, she preelects the perfect candidate for every job opening.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl seemed to preelect the best nesting spot in the tree.

meanings.sent1: The company will preelect the new CEO before the shareholders' meeting.
meanings.sent2: The tradition is to preelect the team captain at the beginning of the season.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if we could preelect our pets for specific daily tasks!
meanings.sent4: She seemed to preelect her favorite book as the next book club read.
meanings.sent5: The experienced coach could preelect the star player from a mile away.
